intro: Mimulus exiguus, commonly known as the narrowleaf monkeyflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to western North America. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in loose racemes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mimulus exiguus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, streambanks, and disturbed sites. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
